clinical_study.brief_title: To Evaluate Ezetimibe Plus Atorvastatin Versus Atorvastatin in Patients With High Cholesterol Not Controlled on Atorvastatin 40 mg (0653-090)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Rand., Double-Blind, Titration Study to Evaluate & Compare the Efficacy & Safety of Ezetimibe Plus Atorvastatin Vs Atorvastatin in Hypercholesterolemic Pts. at High Risk for CHD Not Adequately Controlled on Atorvastatin 40 Mg

brief_summary.textblock: To Evaluate and Compare the Efficacy and Safety of Ezetimibe Plus Atorvastatin Versus Atorvastatin in Hypercholesterolemic Patients at High Risk for Coronary Heart Disease Not Adequately Controlled on Atorvastatin 40 mg.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 6 in Low-Density Lipoprotein (LDL)-C
primary_outcome.description: Percent Change in LDL-C = [(week 6 value - baseline value)/baseline value]*100%

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 6 in High-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C)
secondary_outcome.description: Percent Change in HDL-C = [(week 6 value - baseline value)/baseline value]*100%

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 6 in Non-High-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (Non-HDL-C)
secondary_outcome.description: Percent Change in Non-HDL-C = [(week 6 value - baseline value)/baseline value]*100%

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 6 in Total-Cholesterol
secondary_outcome.description: Percent Change in Total-C = [(week 6 value - baseline value)/baseline value]*100%

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 6 in Triglycerides (TG)
secondary_outcome.description: Percent Change in TG = [(week 6 value - baseline value)/baseline value]*100%

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 6 in Apolipoprotein B (Apo B)
secondary_outcome.description: Percent Change in Apo B = [(week 6 value - baseline value)/baseline value]*100%

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 6 in Apolipoprotein A-I (Apo A-I)
secondary_outcome.description: Percent Change in Apo A-I = [(week 6 value - baseline value)/baseline value]*100%

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 6 in Total-Cholesterol (TC):High-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C) Ratio
secondary_outcome.description: Percent Change in TC:HDL-C Ratio = [(week 6 ratio - baseline ratio)/baseline ratio]*100%

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 6 in Low-Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol:High-Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (LDL-C:HDL-C) Ratio
secondary_outcome.description: Percent Change in LDL-C:HDL-C Ratio = [(week 6 ratio - baseline ratio)/baseline ratio]*100%

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 6 in Apolipoprotein B:Apolipoprotein A-I (Apo B:Apo A-I) Ratio
secondary_outcome.description: Percent Change in Apo B:Apo A-I Ratio = [(week 6 ratio - baseline ratio)/baseline ratio]*100%

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 6 in Non-High-Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol:High-Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (Non-HDL-C:HDL-C) Ratio
secondary_outcome.description: Percent Change in non-HDL-C:HDL-C Ratio = [(week 6 ratio - baseline ratio)/baseline ratio]*100%

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 6 in C Reactive Protein (CRP)
secondary_outcome.description: Percent Change in CRP = [(week 6 value - baseline value)/baseline value]*100%

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Attained Target Low-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C) <70 mg/dL at Week 6

intervention.description: Atorvastatin 80 mg tablet by mouth, once a day for 6 weeks
Atorvastatin 40 mg by mouth, once a day for 6 weeks
Ezetimibe 10 mg tablets by mouth, once a day for 6 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient with LDL-C >70 mg/dL & on a stable dose of atorvastatin 40 mg
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or lactating women or intending to become pregnant
- Patient with sensitivity or intolerance to ezetimibe or atorvastatin

link.description: MedWatch - FDA maintained medical product safety Information
Merck: Patient & Caregiver U.S. Product Web Site

reference.citation: Leiter LA, Bays H, Conard S, Bird S, Rubino J, Hanson ME, Tomassini JE, Tershakovec AM. Efficacy and safety of ezetimibe added on to atorvastatin (40 mg) compared with uptitration of atorvastatin (to 80 mg) in hypercholesterolemic patients at high risk of coronary heart disease. Am J Cardiol. 2008 Dec 1;102(11):1495-501. doi: 10.1016/j.amjcard.2008.09.076. Epub 2008 Oct 23.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Phase III First Patient In: 4/6/2006; Last Patient Last Visit 2/26/2008 96 centers worldwide (US, Canada) Eligible patients include those on a stable dose of atorvastatin 40 mg; or patients with adjusted LDLC pre-screen ranges who were treated with other lipid modifying therapy, or were statin and/or ezetimibe naïve.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients received and were blinded to atorvastatin 40 mg for a 4/5- week run-in period. Patients needed an LDL-C ≥ 70 mg/dL and ≤ 160 mg/dL at Visit 2 (week -1). Eligible patients were randomized at Visit 3 (Week 0) to either atorvastatin 80 mg or addition of ezetimibe 10 mg to their 40 mg dose of atorvastatin for a 6-week treatment period.

group.title: Atorvastatin + Ezetemibe
group.description: Atorvastatin 40 mg + Ezetemibe 10 mg every day for 6 weeks

group.description: Atorvastatin 80 mg every day for 6 weeks

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 6 in Low-Density Lipoprotein (LDL)-C
outcome.description: Percent Change in LDL-C = [(week 6 value - baseline value)/baseline value]*100%
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): The FAS population includes all randomized patients who took at least 1 dose of study medication and had a baseline (BL) value and at least one post BL value. Post BL measurements up to 3 days following the last dose of double-blind study medication were included in the analysis.

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 6 in Triglycerides (TG)
measure.description: Percent Change in TG = [(week 6 value - baseline value)/baseline value]*100%

analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA using ranks based on normal scores (Tukey method) with model terms for treatment and baseline triglycerides value.
analysis.estimate_desc: The median difference is based on the Hodges-Lehmann estimates of shift; The distribution-free 95% CI is based on Wilcoxon’s rank sum test statistic.

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline to Week 6 in C Reactive Protein (CRP)
measure.description: Percent Change in CRP = [(week 6 value - baseline value)/baseline value]*100%

analysis.method_desc: LDA method of Liang and Zeger with model terms: treatment, time, and the interaction of time by treatment.
analysis.estimate_desc: Data for analysis was transformed by the natural log and the difference in geometric mean % change from BL calculated based on the difference in the back-transformed least squares means.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
